sentences: Gloria Mann was an American pop singer born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
Mann scored two hits on the U.S. Billboard Hot 100 in 1955.
The first was a cover version of "Earth Angel", which reached number 18.
Later that year, "A Teenage Prayer" peaked at number 19; this featured Sid Bass leading the backing orchestra.
Both were released on Sound Records.
Mann's son, Bob Rosenberg, formed the group Will to Power.
In 2003, a compilation album, Don't Call Me Barry: The Best of Gloria Mann was released.
Joel Whitburn, The Billboard Book of Top 40 Hits.
